abstract: The warning came amid official anger over lengthy delays and large cost overruns at the field, discovered in 2000.
snippet: The warning came amid official anger over lengthy delays and large cost overruns at the field, discovered in 2000.
lead_paragraph: The government of Kazakhstan threatened yesterday to suspend work performed by a consortium of foreign oil companies at the Kashagan offshore field, one of the world’s largest oil projects, because of an assertion of environmental damage in the Caspian Sea.

headline.main: Kazakhstan Threatens to Halt Work on Big Offshore Oil Project
headline.print_headline: Kazakhstan Threatens to Halt Work on Big Offshore Oil Project
